semantic_title: Coding for Patients Receiving Therapeutic Services Only
section_path: Section IV > L. Patients receiving therapeutic services only

content.full_text: For patients receiving therapeutic services only during an encounter/visit, sequence first the diagnosis, condition, problem, or other reason for encounter/visit shown in the medical record to be chiefly responsible for the outpatient services provided during the encounter/visit. Codes for other diagnoses (e.g., chronic conditions) may be sequenced as additional diagnoses. (Evidence: pg no: 114, L85-L86)
content.summary: Establishes sequencing rules for therapeutic service encounters, prioritizing the condition chiefly responsible for services with additional codes for other relevant diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 114, L85-L86)
key_concepts: Sequence first the reason chiefly responsible for therapeutic services (Evidence: pg no: 114, L85-L86)
Other diagnoses may be sequenced as additional codes (Evidence: pg no: 114, L86)
Applies to therapeutic services only encounters (Evidence: pg no: 114, L85)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Sequence first the reason chiefly responsible for therapeutic services (Evidence: pg no: 114, L85-L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: The primary code should represent the main condition, problem, or reason that is chiefly responsible for the therapeutic services provided (Evidence: pg no: 114, L85-L86)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code other diagnoses as additional diagnoses when relevant (Evidence: pg no: 114, L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: Chronic conditions and other diagnoses that are relevant to the encounter may be coded as secondary diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 114, L86)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm encounter is for therapeutic services only
Step 2: Identify the main condition requiring therapeutic services
Step 3: Determine what is chiefly responsible for services provided
Step 4: Sequence this condition as first-listed diagnosis
Step 6: Code relevant conditions as additional diagnoses
